discussion.title: BoundsError during `eval_tree_array`
discussion.body:
I make new inputs `r = [6.332061275761631 5.051237472144821 2.7 4.2690748412273125 3.3068111527572905 5.4 4.676537180435969 6.037383539249433 5.727564927611035 3.818376618407357 1.9091883092036785]`.

and execute `_eval_tree_array`
like this `result, finished =  _eval_tree_array(tree, r, operators, (turbo ? Val(true) : Val(false))) `

its working for some time and then  error occurs. 
` BoundsError: attempt to access 1Ã—11 Matrix{Float32} at index [2, 1:11]`

I understood that it comes from `deg0_eval` -> `return (cX[tree.feature, :], true)`

May be i should define `r` differently ? i don't understand where it finds other features

nodes.body: What is your `tree`? It looks like your expression has a feature=2 node, which is out-of-bounds for your input data. i.e., you would need to provide a 2D array with dimensions 2x11 instead.
